headline: Middle East Netanyahu Reportedly Decides Full Occupation Gaza Strip
summary: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu reportedly decided to fully occupy Gaza, sparking controversy within Israel and abroad due to theongoing war with Hamasand thehumanitarian crisisin the region.The Details:According to multiple sources, Netanyahu's decision has been communicated to Lieutenant General Eyal Zamir, the army's Chief of Staff, with an ultimatum to either agree with the decision or resign. Expansion of the occupation is expected to include operations in areas wherehostagesare being held.For Context:Israel has been atwar with Hamas for 21 months, a conflict that has resulted intens of thousands of deathsand a severe humanitarian crisis in Gaza. Hamas continues to hold 50 Israeli hostages, with only 20 believed to be alive. There has been growing international pressure for aceasefire, but negotiations have been fraught with difficulties. Thelargest known evacuation of wounded childrenfrom Gaza to the US is also expected to be carried out by the non-profit organization HEAL Palestine this week.How the Media Covered It:Mediaite (Lean Left bias)emphasized the criticism Netanyahu faces over his handling of the war, and highlighted his refusal to engage in ceasefire talks despite calls from the international community. On the other hand, theNew York Post (Lean Right)focused on the belief of senior Israeli officials that Hamas will not free the remaining hostages without being forced to surrender.
